metadata.title: CVE-2015-5345 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The Mapper component in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.68,8.x before 8.0.30, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 processes redirects beforeconsidering security constraints and Filters, which allows remote attackersto determine the existence of a directory via a URL that lacks a trailing /(slash) character.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.6').
tomcat6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1').
